Fiberwise summation for extended non-negative reals.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9354503677/job/25747507736)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9354503677/job/25747506931)
Nitpicking comments, but this looks good!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ' (x : ), ' (b : (g ' {x})), f b = ' i : , f i := ```

```suggestion
theorem tsum_fiberwise (f :   0) (g :   ) :
```
We use the notation for ENNReal most of the time.

Term mode proofs tend to be much harder to read than tactic proofs, where it is easier to read the order of arguments and the elementary steps. So, as a general rule, we avoid term mode for proofs which are longer than one line, although this is not an absolute rule. Do you think you could try to convert your proof to tactic mode?

```suggestion
    ' x, ' b : g ' {x}, f b = ' i, f i := by
  apply HasSum.tsum_eq
  let equiv := Equiv.sigmaFiberEquiv g
  apply (equiv.hasSum_iff.mpr ENNReal.summable.hasSum).sigma
  exact fun _  ENNReal.summable.hasSum_iff.mpr rfl
```
Thanks a lot, this looks great! I have removed a few useless parentheses (this tends to increase readability) and type annotations, and changed the last `apply` to `exact` (because this indicates this is the end of the proof). I have also used dot notation. This is just to show you some tricks, your proof was already perfectly acceptable!
